Package com.egehurturk.httpd

Class HttpResponse

java.lang.Object
com.egehurturk.httpd.HttpResponse
public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
This server uses HttpRequest and to pass state through server The server, specifically HttpServer for HTTP Based communication will get in this object as META information, e.g. headers

Using this class is convenient to store Metadata about HTTP request lifecycle, reaching headers in a dictionary format. Every impending request will be wrapped around this.

Fields provide basic container-like acccess to requests. Client, e.g. Chrome (browser) will make the request. ServerSocket.accept() method accepts the request, as defined in BaseServer. Note that the values (fields) of this matches with the "Accept-<...>" values ~ more description needed ~

    • create

      public static HttpResponse create​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map, java.lang.String scheme, int code, java.lang.String message, byte[] body, java.io.PrintWriter stream) throws HttpResponseException
      Creates {@link this}
      Parameters:
      map - - Headers for response. Note that this map does not contain any headers for request. This map is written manually by the server
      scheme - - Http scheme (HTTP/1.1)
      code - - Status code
      message - - Status message
      body - - Content body
      Returns:
      - new HttpResponse object
      Throws:
      HttpResponseException - - any errors associated with response lifecycle
